original: Ahlstrand, Josef Thorsten, apotekare, Motala, f. 22/12/86 i Appuna, östergötl. 1., av org. o. folkskilär. J. N. E. A. o. Mimmi Bengtson. — Mogiex. i Jöwköp. 06, farm. fand. 10, apot i-ex. 14. Elev v. apot. i Vadstena 07-09, anst. där 09-38, priv. å apot. i Skänninge 38-46, å apot. i Motala sed. 46. Led. av stadsfullm., hälsovindn samt styr. f. System A-B i Vadstena 30-38, huv iman samt led. av styr. f. Vadstena Stads Sparbank 34-38.
translated: Ahlstrand, Josef Thorsten, pharmacist, from Motala, born on December 22, 1886 in Appuna, Östergötland, firstborn of the organizational and popular educator J.N.E.A. and Mimmi Bengtson. - Graduated from the School of Pharmacy in Jönköping in 1906, pharmaceutical apprentice in 1910, licensed pharmacist in 1914. He was a student at the Vadstena Pharmacy from 1907-1909, employed there from 1909-1938, privately employed at the Skänninge Pharmacy from 1938-1946, and at the Motala Pharmacy from 1946. He was a member of the City Council, the Health Board, and the Management Board for System A-B in Vadstena from 1930-1938, as well as the chief priest and a member of the board for the Vadstena City Savings Bank from 1934-1938. He married in 19xx.
